channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.

item.title: Twisted bilayer Ice as a new class of hydrogen-bonding moiré materials
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 01 October 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-63833-0

Existing Moiré materials are mostly van der Waals heterostructures. Here the authors show that hydrogen-bond adaptability allows spontaneous formation of twisted bilayer ice at magic angles in 2D confinement, establishing a new class of Moiré materials.
item.dc:title: Twisted bilayer Ice as a new class of hydrogen-bonding moiré materials
item.dc:creator: Liya Wang
Jian Jiang
Siyi Liu
Shuying Lin
Jiajie Yan
YinBo Zhu
Jun Xia
Ruijie Wang
Chengyuan Wang
Chun Tang
Xiao Cheng Zeng

item.title: Scalable solution-processed ferroelectric polymers exhibiting markedly enhanced piezoelectricity
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 01 October 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-63849-6

Previous approaches to enhance the weak piezoelectric coefficients in ferroelectric polymers depend on synthesis of desired composition and complex processing conditions with low scalability. Here the authors report large piezoelectric coefficient in scalable solution-processed ferroelectric poly(vinylidene fluoride-co-trifluoroethylene) copolymers by modifying C=C and C=O double bonds.
item.dc:title: Scalable solution-processed ferroelectric polymers exhibiting markedly enhanced piezoelectricity
item.dc:creator: Ze Yuan
Hui Tong
Zekai Fei
Chenyi Li
Yang Liu
